org.openimaj.video.capture

Class VideoCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<MBFImage>
      • org.openimaj.video.capture.VideoCapture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<MBFImage>

    public class VideoCapture
extends Video<MBFImage>
    VideoCapture is a type of Video that can capture live video streams from a webcam or other video device. On OSX and Windows, this is completely dependency-free and no extra software needs to be installed. On linux you need to have video4linux installed.

    Environment variables

    • The environment variable OPENIMAJ_GRABBER_VERBOSE can be set (to any non-zero length value) on windows to make the native library print lots of debugging information
    • The environment variable OPENIMAJ_GRABBER_READ can be set on linux to force the native library use v4l in read-mode rather than through memory mapping the device. This can be useful if you have lots of cameras attached as it reduces the bandwidth required.

    System properties

    • The system property with the name given by DEFAULT_DEVICE_NUMBER_PROPERTY can be used to set the default capture device and can either be a device number, or device identifer string. See VideoCapture(int, int) for more details.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoCapture

        public VideoCapture(int width,
            int height)
             throws VideoCaptureException
        Construct a VideoCapture instance with the requested width and height. The default video device will be used. The actual height and width of the captured frames may not equal the requested size if the underlying platform-specific grabber is not able to honor the request. The actual size can be inspected through the getWidth() and getHeight() methods.

        The default device is usually the first device listed by getVideoDevices(), however this is down to the underlying native libraries and operating system. The DEFAULT_DEVICE_NUMBER_PROPERTY system property allows the selection of the default device to be overridden. The property value can be an integer representing the index of the default device in the list produced by DEFAULT_DEVICE_NUMBER_PROPERTY or a String that includes part of the device identifier. In the case of a String value, the device with the identifier that first contains the value is selected.

        Parameters:
        width - the requested video width
        height - the requested video height
        Throws:
        VideoCaptureException - if no webcam is found, or there is a problem opening it

      • VideoCapture

        public VideoCapture(int width,
            int height,
            Device device)
             throws VideoCaptureException
        Construct a VideoCapture instance with the requested width and height using the specified video device. The actual height and width of the captured frames may not equal the requested size if the underlying platform-specific grabber is not able to honor the request. The actual size can be inspected through the getWidth() and getHeight() methods.
        Parameters:
        width - the requested video width.
        height - the requested video height.
        device - the requested video device.
        Throws:
        VideoCaptureException - if there is a problem opening the webcam

      • VideoCapture

        public VideoCapture(int width,
            int height,
            double fps,
            Device device)
             throws VideoCaptureException
        Construct a VideoCapture instance with the requested width and height using the specified video device. The actual height and width of the captured frames may not equal the requested size if the underlying platform-specific grabber is not able to honor the request. The actual size can be inspected through the getWidth() and getHeight() methods.
        Parameters:
        width - the requested video width.
        height - the requested video height.
        fps - the requested frame rate
        device - the requested video device.
        Throws:
        VideoCaptureException - if there is a problem opening the webcam

      • stopCapture

        public void stopCapture()
        Stop the video capture system. Once stopped, it can only be started again by constructing a new instance of VideoCapture.

      • getNextFrame

        public MBFImage getNextFrame()
        Get the next frame. Increments the frame counter by 1.
        Specified by:
        getNextFrame in class Video<MBFImage>
        Returns:
        the next frame
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - wrapping a VideoCaptureException with the message "Timed out waiting for next frame" if there is a timeout waiting for the next frame. This could potentially be caught and ignored (i.e. the frame is dropped).
        RuntimeException - wrapping a VideoCaptureException with the message "Error occurred getting next frame" if there is an error the next frame. Currently this can only occur on linux.

      • countFrames

        public long countFrames()
        Description copied from class: Video
        Return the number of frames in the whole video. If the video is a live stream, then this method should return -1.
        Specified by:
        countFrames in class Video<MBFImage>
        Returns:
        the number of frames in the whole video or -1 if unknown

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws VideoCaptureException
        Test main method. Lists the available devices, and then opens the first and second capture devices if they are available and displays their video.
        Parameters:
        args - ignored.

      • setCurrentFrameIndex

        public void setCurrentFrameIndex(long newFrame)
        Description copied from class: Video
        Set the current frame index (i.e. skips to a certain frame). If your video subclass can implement this in a cleverer way, then override this method, otherwise this method will simply grab frames until it gets to the given frame index. This method is naive and may take some time as each frame will be decoded by the video decoder.
        Overrides:
        setCurrentFrameIndex in class Video<MBFImage>
        Parameters:
        newFrame - the new index
